Note Package¶

class reamber.base.lists.NotePkg.NotePkg¶

Bases: object

This Package holds multiple note lists

addOffset(by, inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.NotePkg.NotePkg¶

Adds Offset to all items

Parameters

  • by – The offset to add, in milliseconds

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

columns() → Dict[str, List[int]]¶

Gets the columns

abstract data() → Dict[str, reamber.base.lists.notes.NoteList.NoteList]¶

This grabs the data from inherited instances. :rtype: Dict[str, NoteList] :return: The inherited instances must return a dictionary of the lists. It is advised to follow the names used in the convention. Such as hit for hits, note for hits and holds.

deepcopy() → reamber.base.lists.NotePkg.NotePkg¶

Creates a deep copy of itself

df() → Dict[str, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame]¶

Creates a dict pandas DataFrame by looping through the self.data

Returns

Returns a Dictionary of pd.DataFrames

firstLastOffset() → Tuple[float, float]¶

Gets the first and last offset, slightly faster because it’s only sorted once

firstOffset() → float¶

Gets the first offset

inColumns(columns: List[int], inplace: bool = False) → reamber.base.lists.NotePkg.NotePkg¶

Filters by columns for all items

Parameters

  • columns – The columns to filter by, as a list

  • inplace – Whether to just modify this instance or return a modified copy

Returns

Returns a modified copy if not inplace

lastOffset() → float¶

Gets the last offset

maxColumn() → int¶

Gets the maximum column, can be used to determine Key Count if not explicitly stated

method(method: str, **kwargs) → Dict[str, Any]¶

Calls each list’s method with eval. Specify method with a string.

Parameters

  • method – The method to call, the string must be EXACT

  • kwargs – The extra parameter to use

Returns

Returns a Dict as it may not return a NotePkg init-able

objCount() → int¶

Returns the total sum number of items in each list. For number of lists use len()

offsets() → Dict[str, List[float]]¶

Gets the offsets
